_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Farm Product Raw Material Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Harvest Land Cooperative

320 West 1st St.

Morton Mn, 56270

(507)697-6113



For further information contact Aaron Guggisberg, Safety Director

Risk Management- Executive summary



1. The Facility Policy



the ownwers,management and employees of Harvestland cooperative are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of Anhydrous Ammonia and Propane if an accidental release should occur. The facility is prepared to work with local fire department and other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.



2. Harvest Land Cooperative Information



 The primary activity at the facility is the storage and handling of Anhydrous ammonia and Propane sold to Farmers and Harvest Land Cooperative customers.



 Anhydrous Ammonia is received and stored and distributed for the direct application for crop production in the area.



 Propane is stored and distributed to the farmers and customers of Harvest Land for Home heating,Livestock heating and corn Drying in the area



The maximum quanity of anhydrous ammonia stored at this facility is 228,000 pounds in supply tanks and running stock. The maximum quanity of propane stored at this facility is 120,000 pounds in storage tanks.



 The Five year accident history for Harvest Land at this location 

 a. There has been no accidental release of anhydrous ammonia or propane in the past five years



 b. None have caused any deaths,injuries, or significant property damage at Harvestland Cooperative.



 C. To Harvest Lands knowledge none have resulted in offsite deaths,injuries evacuations,sheltering in place property damage, or enviromental damage.



 6. Harvest Land Cooperatives Emergency response program.



     Harvest Land Cooperative

 a. A written emergency action plan in accordance with OSHA standard. 29 CFR 1910.38



 b. Harvest Land has provided state and local authorities the emergency planning and community Right to Know information as required

under SARA title III (EPCRA) 



 c. Coordinated with emergency responders.



7. Harvest Land Cooperative plans to change as needed to improve safety.



 Safety improvements are a on going process at this facility. Periodic evaluations are preformed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions. There are no additional specific Anhydrous Ammonia or Propane safety Recommendations for implentation at this time. 





                                                                                                    Aaron Guggisberg

                                                                                                    HARVEST LAND COOPERATIVE 

                                                                                                    Safety Director
